title: Scottish independence: 13 days to referendum - as it happened | Politics | The Guardian

text: before i close things here today though , i should steer you in the direction of the latest scottish independence referendum weekly review by libby brooks ( here ) .
this week : faslane , academics , a breakthrough poll for yes and the mysterious missing million .
the snp has been responding to the attacks on it from labour over the absence of some snp mps from parliament during today 's vote on a bedroom tax reform measure .
in a statement , snp work and pensions spokesperson dr eilidh whiteford mp argued that the vote demonstrated exactly why scotland needed independence .
she said : this was a defeat for the uk government but it does n't end the bedroom tax which has caused misery for so many people .
every single scottish mp could vote against the bedroom tax and we would still be faced with it because we can be outvoted by tory votes from the south .

labour 's hypocrisy on this issue is simply breathtaking - every single one of their scottish mps is working hand in glove in the no campaign with the tory government who have given us the bedroom tax in the first place .
labour are keeping up the pressure meanwhile .
here 's part of a statement put out by ed miliband : alex salmond tries to con people into thinking he stands up for social justice .
what happened today is that the majority of his mps did not even turn up .
they could not be bothered to turn up to abolish the bedroom tax .
it says it all about how alex salmond is trying to con people .
i 'm going to leave them to it now and am wrapping up the blog for today .
thanks for reading

documents.title: blog review
text: here 's a quick look at some of what 's around on the referendum in scottish blogs at the moment .
i was given some friendly stick about missing out on two of those from the no side of the debate the other day , although it appears that they have n't been updated for a few days .

the chokka blog ( which has been recommended by a number of people ) published its most recent post on sunday , when its author looked at the apparent knock-on effects and coverage of his work in some mainstream media outlets .
looking forward to the next post there from kevin hague .

the most recent post in notes from north britain was published last friday when adam tomkins , professor of public law at the university of glasgow , shared some thoughts on 'scotland and the eu ' : not only have the snp now dropped their absurd line about automatic '' eu membership , they have tried to bury it .

in november 2013 the scottish ministers published a document , scotland in the eu , in which it was claimed that the scottish government has always recognised that the terms of scotland 's independent membership of the eu will be subject to negotiations with other member states '' .
this is just one of many untruths uttered by the snp in the long independence referendum campaign .

on the yes side , bella calledonia has a piece today by wilson mcleod on 'the non-issue of gaelic in the indyref debate ' in which he writes : on the few occasions when language issues have arisen , it seems clear that many of those deeply engaged with the independence question , people who have grappled long and hard with what they see as core social and economic issues , have given minimal attention to matters of language and when they are called upon to address them do so crudely and naively , in a manner that suggests a lack of intellectual and emotional engagement .

the national collective has a piece by keith mcivor headlined 'independence offers the possibility to start again ' : on the 'journey ' from being a no voter to becoming a yes voter , he writes i still think of myself as opposed to nationalism .

i think the notion of nations is an outdated historical anomaly that seems out of step with the the world we live in and the world i spend a large part of my working life travelling around and experiencing .
however , a bit over year ago , after much thought , soul searching and engaging with the debate i did a u-turn and am now very much a yes supporter .
a little insight now into how complaints about the bbc 's recent coverage of one part of the referendum campaign ranks in relation to the middle east and , of course , the quiz show pointless .
jim waterson ( @ jimwaterson ) here 's what 's topping the bbc 's most complained about list .
israel/gaza bias ?
nah .
an interesting development to watch out for tomorrow : left-wing activists from london will be heading to scotland to support the yes campaign .
the trip has been co-ordinated by red pepper magazine following a meeting of at the house of commons back in june .

a press release issued by the magazine said that dozens are expected to make their way from london to scotland this weekend on what it calls the 'red pepper yes train ' and will be campaigning on the streets of glasgow , paisley and edinburgh .
jane shallice , a retired teacher in london who is joining the trip , said : we 're on our way to scotland to show that there are many of us in london and beyond that support scottish independence .
of course the rich and powerful are against independence , but we 're heading to scotland to say that many ordinary people in england support the yes campaign .

hilary wainwright , co-editor of red pepper magazine , said : not only is scottish independence in the interests of the majority of scots , it also has potential for exciting , progressive change south of the border .

on arrival in glasgow tomorrow , the activists will be welcomed by members of the radical independence campaign and are expected to take part in canvassing , street stalls and meetings over the weekend .
radical independence ( @ radical indy ) welcome the yes train to scotland with @ twitterid 3pm , glasgow central .
details : # radicalyes

documents.title: sturgeon profile
text: here 's something to really get your teeth into : a detailed profile of nicola sturgeon by the guardian 's libby brooks , who writes that few doubt the deputy first minister 's time as first minister will come .
it contains the following quote from one holyrood-watcher : she is the heir apparent but she has to avoid getting whatever gordon brown suffered from .
the profile looks closely at sturgeon 's political relationship with salmond .
sturgeon makes no secret of being to the left of salmond , and is known to be the only person in cabinet who can disagree with him and get away with it .
they have argued over snp policy on nato and corporation tax ; most recently over salmond 's lack of clarity on currency union .
sturgeon was seen shaking her head at the first minister 's bizarre line of questioning about aliens as she watched the first salmond v alistair darling tv debate live at glasgow 's conservatoire .
read it in full here .
scottish deputy first minister nicola sturgeon speaks at the scottish national party conference in perth in 2013 .
macleod

a war of words ( yes , one of those ) has broken out between a former chief of mi6 and an ex counter terrorism chief for the police in scotland over the former 's claims that plans for a single security and intelligence service in an independent scotland will not offer the level of protection and support currently provided as part of the uk .
writing in the times newspaper , john scarlett said that british intelligence services have been built up over decades - work which can not be replicated in just a few years '' .
the scottish government set out proposals to create a single agency for security and intelligence to ensure scotland 's national security in its white paper on independence .

scarlett , who served as chief of the british secret intelligence service from 2004 to 2009 , said : in my view , the scottish government proposals will not offer the level of protection and support currently provided by the highly-sophisticated british security and intelligence agencies .

but allan burnett , previously counter-terrorism co-ordinator with the association of chief police officers in scotland , said scarlett was a prime mover in drawing up the so called 'dodgy dossier ' which falsely reported saddam hussein possessed weapons of mass destruction which could be deployed within 45 minutes .

burnett , a yes supporter , said : he was also one of the intelligence officers most closely associated with ( tony ) blair 's disastrous and illegal invasion of iraq in 2003 , the effects of which we are still regretting at international , national and personal levels .
our friends , including those south of the border , will want scotland as intelligence allies as much as we want them .
our scottish intelligence service will be welcomed as a professional , trusted ally .
amy macdonald has been added to the line-up for the sell-out a night for scotland pro-independence concert .
she will join franz ferdinand , mogwai , frightened rabbit , mcintosh ross , eddi reader and comedian elaine c smith at the usher hall , edinburgh , on september 14 .
amy macdonald has been added to the a night for scotland pro-independence concert .
generation yes , the yes campaign 's young movement , has issued what it calls a youth declaration . ''
it lists a series of demands by we , the young people of scotland '' including the government we vote for , every time , '' an end to austerity and the removal of trident .
miriam brett of generation yes said : yes is becoming a progressive , cool and trendy thing for young people .
we have run out of our badges 'i only kiss yes voters ' because the demand is so popular .
in school debates you can see kids in the audience with their yes badges on .
it 's building a culture of hope where people see change as something to not be scared of , they see it as something to be excited by .

labour are seeking to capitalise on the absence of some snp mps from westminster today for a vote on a bedroom tax reform measure which just passed narrowly with the liberal democrats backing labour in the house of commons .
scottish labour ( @ scottishlabour ) why were @ twitterid , @ twitterid , @ twitterid and @ twitterid absent from the knife edge vote on the bedroom tax today ?

# indyref alan roden , political editor at the scottish daily mail , tweets : alan roden ( @ alanroden ) pr disaster for snp when it is trying to grab left-wing votes : only 2 mps bothered to turn up to vote against bedroom tax .

the liberal democrats have been applauding the speech earlier today by former prime minister gordon brown , who said he would seek to spearhead efforts to secure rapid implementation of more powers for the scottish parliament in the event of a no vote ( see 11.48.am post ) .
speaking at a road to the referendum event in rutherglen tonight , scottish liberal demcorat leader willie rennie will say that the arrival of more powers is unstoppable . ''
he will add : only today , gordon brown put his full weight behind more powers in the event of a no vote .
i welcome that .
and just recently i walked with ruth davidson and johann lamont to calton hill to state our firm commitment to more powers .
nick clegg and other uk party leaders have made clear that they want to see change unlocked across the uk .
and outside of those elected by the people , we have trade unions , think tanks , people in your workplaces and communities willing for radical change for scotland as part of the uk .
labour has accused snp mps of failing to turn up in parliament today for what it described as a knife edge vote '' to oppose the so-called bedroom tax .

margaret curran said that today 's vote was a vote for social justice across the uk '' as the tories failed to secure a majority in the house of commons.the labour shadow scottish secretary added : alex salmond 's snp have put their campaign to break up the uk ahead of the people of scotland .
every scottish labour mp left the campaign trail today to come to parliament to vote against the bedroom tax .
this vote was on a knife edge , but the nationalists did n't even bother to turn up .
this vote has been won by scotland 's labour mps .

nicola sturgeon has been seeking to push home the yes campaign 's strategy of building support among different scottish communities , saying that campaigning today in glasgow , where she visited the city 's central mosque , the deputy first minister said : scotland 's success on the world stage is built on innovation and a rich and diverse cultural heritage - that outward looking and inclusive approach will blossom on the world stage with a yes vote and independence .

in scotland there are families from pakistan and poland , india and ireland , england and italy and people from many other parts of the world living , working and making a positive contribution to modern scotland - this is something worth celebrating .
a yes vote is an opportunity to embed equality , tolerance and human rights in our constitution and ensure that we can grow our economy and tackle poverty .

the scottish conservatives have been attacking the independence case on defence , saying that an independent scotland would have to find an additional £ 500 million a year to meet nato guidelines on defence spending .
a statement put out by the conservatives says that nato states that members should aspire to setting aside at least two per cent of gross domestic product ( gdp ) to their defence budget .

the tories add however that the snp has committed in its white paper to an annual spend of only £ 2.5 billion , while also claiming an independent scotland would be accepted as a member of the north atlantic treaty organisation '' .

tory leader ruth davidson said : as part of the uk , scotland has the most professional armed forces in the world - which the first minister now wants to rip apart to realise his obsession with independence .
we already sit at nato 's top table and alex salmond 's fag-packet plans for defence put that at risk .
our country is safer and more secure because we 're part of the uk - independence would damage our armed forces and hurt our security .
si ?
a new yes group has been unveiled : italians for yes .
around 100,000 people of italian descent now live in scotland according to yes scotland , which has put out a release about the launch of the group at la brava restaurant in east renfrewshire .
figures who are part of the group include the scots-italian msp for east kilbride , linda fabiani , and carmen pieraccini , an actor from the bbc soap rivercity .
pieraccini said : scots-italians are some of the most driven and ambitious people out there and very much in the driving seat of their future .
with yes we have a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to use our wealth for scotland and make scotland the success we all know it can be .

the advertising campaigns by both sides of the referndum debate are so similar that if you swapped the logos around then you would barely be able to spot the difference , according to a london advertising expert quoted in the huffington post .

chris hirst , the chief executive of advertising agency grey london : neither side seems to have done anything that 's particularly memorable , nor is it easy to find anything from either side that is really very message-based .

hirst added that classic political advertising is stuff we remember '' and suggested that nothing in the scottish referendum campaign had come close to the conservative party 's anti-blair advert ' new labour , new danger ' in terms of voter recollection .
the conservative party 's 'blair demon eyes ' poster .
and on that note i 'm going to take a break for a while and go in search of a good cup of coffee ( recommendations for central edinburgh very welcome ) .
back in a wee bit .
a daily mash take on referendum events now .

alex salmond has told ed miliband to 'button it ' after the labour leader tried to expose his epic scam '' , according to a report in the mash , which is headlined : you con your idiots , i 'll con mine , salmond tells miliband
scottish labour has said that it will be targeting snp voters in the final phase of the referendum campaign .

speaking after she took a large group of young activists into the constituency of deputy first minister nicola sturgeon today , scottish labour leader johann lamont said : we know that alex salmond 's win in 2011 was achieved despite their policy of independence and the voters who gave the snp their support for the first time in that election are key to this referendum .
in nicola sturgeon 's constituency in glasgow southside , we are speaking to labour and snp supporters and are finding two no voters for every yes voter .
scottish labour leader johann lamont joins labour activists while campaigning in deputy first minister nicola sturgeon 's constituency in govan .
j mitchell/getty images

the snp have also pounced on comments last night by former labour defence minister george robertson , who said that independence would create some minor entity at the north of britain '' during a bbc scotland programme .

snp defence spokesperson angus robertson said : many people , whatever their political views , will be offended at this sort of arrogant , patronising approach to scotland , which is yet more evidence of a no campaign in deep trouble .
the snp have issued a statement welcoming news that the workforce at the ferguson shipyard is set to increase by 50 percent by next year .

businessman jim mccoll , the owner of heavy engineering group clyde blowers , said he had no doubt '' about the future potential of the yard and said that scotland 's shipbuilding industry could flourish after a yes vote .
mccoll also said that a yes vote would give scotland the levers of power to support the industry - and allow us to rebalance the economy away from london-centric activities . ''
it 's probably an understatement to say that a lot of work went into the sky news scotland megamix .
here it is : the sky news scotland megamix
the latest issue of the us magazine newsweek covers the referendum .
it 's a joint piece by simon akam ( the englishman '' ) and finlay young ( the scotsman '' ) alex hern ( @ alexhern ) this seems to misstate the parameters of the debate , somewhat ?

documents.title: brown : no vote does n't mean no change
text: gordon brown has been speaking at an event at the house of commons in london today where he said that a no '' vote does not mean no change , arguing that the referendum is a choice between separation and a stronger scottish parliament .

the former prime minister , who is proposing a new union '' as a constitutional partnership of equals , told the event organised by the new labour pressure group , progress : a no vote will instead usher in further constitutional reforms .
we should now be clear how far these reforms should go and recognise that not only the labour party but also the liberal democrats and the conservatives are committed to them .

brown went on to say : the reason i am speaking in westminster today , as well as speaking in scotland , is that it is not only scotland that must and will change : westminster must and will change , london must and will change and the united kingdom must and will change .

already with the scottish parliament , legislative assemblies in wales and northern ireland and a high-powered london authority taking powers from the centre , britain will never again be the unitary state we were taught about at school .
nor will the old theory of an undivided westminster sovereignty ever again conform to the new realities .
in its own sphere of decision-making the scottish parliament holds full power and its decisions are not overruled by westminster .
he added : by voting no , scotland can endorse a principle we believe in and helped implement .
we can retain the benefits of this system of pooling and sharing resources across the uk , while securing further powers for the scottish parliament consistent with it .
the full speech can be read here .

the snp will be a big winner '' even if scotland votes no and political parties fail to make manifesto commitments to deliver sweeping new powers for the edinburgh parliament , according to the former plaid cymru leader , dafydd wigley .

speaking to an audience of welsh americans yesterday ( thanks to poblachdnahalba to for point out this by the way ) he said : [ when ] it comes to formulating an election manifesto , with the referendum over , there will be kicking and screaming from those who think that scotland has ruled the political roost for far too long and if it has voted no , then should be shunted back into a political siding from which it should never again be allowed to emerge .
if half a hint of that gets through to the scottish people before the uk general election , there will be only one winner : the scottish national party .

documents.title: salmond : fishing will be priority in independence scotland
text: fishing will be a national priority in an independence scotland , first minister alex salmond will pledge today at a meeting in peterhead fish market .
speaking in advance , he said : a yes vote is a huge opportunity for scotland 's fishing industry .
it means that never again will it be considered expendable '' - as westminster described it .
scotland 's fishing and seafood sectors are great industries and play an important part in our economic success .

as such they are many times more important to scotland than to the uk as a whole , and for that reason they will be a much greater priority in an independent scotland - indeed they will be a national priority .

the fishing industry contributes £ 550 million to the scottish economy every year and helps to underpin a food and drink industry which has a turnover of almost £ 14 billion , according to the figures in the snp press release .
a fishing boat heads out to sea at eyemouth harbour , in the scottish borders .
cheskin/pa
the vote by members of the rmt union in favour of a yes vote to scottish independence was something that i did n't have time to up on yesterday , so here are some of the details .
members backed independence by a margin of 1,051 to 968 in a ballot of the union 's 9,000 scottish membership .
there was 365 undecideds and a 25percent turnout .
major unions such as unison have not stated a position so it makes the rmt ( which is not affiliated to labour ) the first industrial trade union to back a yes vote .
however , the prison officers association scotland is backing yes while aslef , gmb and community ( labour affiliates ) are backing a no vote .
here was some of the twitter reaction : john b ( @ johnb78 ) jailers and train guards now endorsing yes .

if they 're really lucky they 'll get traffic wardens too alex salmond ( @ alexsalmond ) welcome news that members of the rmt rail workers ' union have voted to back independence # indyref thane lawrie ( @ redstart09 ) # indyref great to see rmt union come out in support of a yes vote .

i hope this inspires trade unionists and labour supporters to do same kevin schofield ( @ schofieldkevin ) struggling to see how the rmt - which disaffiliated from labour a decade ago - backing yes is a `` humiliation '' for labour , as the snp claim .

'scottish referendum horror ' - it 's a whole new film genre apparently , nothing to do with being a captive audience in the back of a taxi .
so here 's the guardian review of white settlers , in which a relocated english couple ( spoiler alert ? )
get terrorised by their new scottish neighbours .
it 's not going to win any oscars by the sounds of it .
reviewer anna smith says that the storyline is formulaic and single-minded '' .

a piece of furniture created by one of scotland 's leading furniture design schools to mark the referendum is to go on display in central edinburgh .

the piece has been christened the 'referendum cabinet ' while richard demarco , one of scotland 's foremost advocates of contemporary art describes it as an iconic piece of furniture of both national and international importance . ''

according to a press release from the chippendale international school of furniture : the intricately-inlaid cabinet tells an interwoven story of scotland 's heritage and history and of its place in the union ahead of the independence referendum on 18th september .
i 'm not sure if you 'll be able to try it out but if you want to seen you should visit george pirie antiques from this monday until september 19 , the day after the vote .

documents.title: press review
text: the financial times reporting on ed miliband 's visit to blantyre yesterday , the ft 's george parker says that the referendum is labour 's to lose .

inside , martin wolf has a opinion column headlined : 'if scots keep the pound they forgo independence ' in which he writes that a currency union would be one in which the scots have far less weight than now .

the herald the headline on the herald 's splash is 'salmond : miliband is blind to the real fight in scotland ' above a story in which kate devlin reports that the first minister has accused the labour leader of fighting the wrong fight '' in scotland and being blind to the ground shifting under his feet '' .

the guardian a report on labour 's plans to send some of its big guns north makes the inside of the guardian , alongside a two page piece by michael white who writes : 'a unionist win has long seemed assured , but as decision day nears the yes bandwagon is gathering pace . '

the scotsman pictures of alex salmond with voters taking selfies on the streets of glagow are spread across the top of two pages inside the scotsman , underneath a page lead on the rmt rail union becoming the first trade union to vote to back a yes vote .

the times a right hand front page story on the times reports that fracking in the north sea could generate £ 300 billion in tax revenues , according to the report produced by n-56 , a business group aiming to find new strategies for scotland 's economy .

the daily telegraph the telegraph reports on a smaller front page piece that ed miliband caused a major rift in the campaign to prevent the break-up of britain yesterday by defying appeals from alistair darling to stop attacking ruth davidson , the scottish tory leader .

the scottish daily mail splashing on the plight of the scottish man being held hostage by the islamic state , the mail has a two page spread inside headlined : 'miliband 's battle for labour 's lost . '
oddly enough , my next door news agency had no daily records ( sold out ? )
but i 'll come back to that a bit later along with , hopefully , a review of blogs .
today 's newspapers in scotland .
quinn

whatever comes of scotland 's impending independence referendum , britain owes it a vote of thanks for staging a festival of democracy '' over the course of six months , writes simon jenkins in today 's guardian .
as a british citizen residing in london , he would vote no , but would make a different decision if he was a scot residing in edinburgh .
i would vote yes because the no campaign has offered merely stasis .
its leader alistair darling 's vision is of union as sole guarantor of prosperity .
yet this paternalism has trapped scotland in dependency and lack of enterprise for half a century .
nor is it clear what his offer of devo max really means .
if scotland were able to raise more of its own taxes , the risk is that the treasury would offset them with cuts in the subvention .
scotland might see a more adventurous future , but it would remain in political shackles .
as it happens , he also believes that the vision of alex salmond is equally flawed '' .
read the piece in full here .
i 'm going to grab the morning papers .
back in a bit .

labour is planning a last ditch effort to stave off a humiliating defeat in the referendum as a series of major figures from the party including john prescot , ed balls and gordon brown take to the campaign trail next week severin carrell and libby brooks report for the guardian : the former prime minister and lord prescott , who was deputy leader under tony blair , will lead a series of party rallies next week in an effort to shore up the no vote in core areas of central scotland after a poll suggested nearly a third of labour voters could back independence on 18 september .

with pressure mounting on his party within the no campaign to prevent a haemorrhage of labour voters moving to vote yes , ed miliband , the labour leader , told reporters : all of us feel a huge sense of responsibility in this ; it 's an incredible time for the uk , for the future of our country and for building social justice in scotland . ''

pollsters have detected a late surge in support for independence as alex salmond 's government has partly redefined the referendum as a protest vote against the tories , lifting the yes vote to within three percentage points of a win , according to yougov and survation .

although the same polls suggest 20 % of snp voters will vote no , the scale of labour 's vote in scotland and its antipathy to the tories offers the independence campaign a clear opportunity to present the referendum as a chance to rid scotland of a conservative government permanently .
good morning and welcome to the guardian 's daily live blog coverage of the scottish referendum campaign .

among events today , the yes scotland campaign will seek to argue that independence is an opportunity for all sectors of scottish society as deputy first minister nicola sturgeon holds meetings with communities in glasgow labour will meanwhile take its fight against independence to scottish nationalists , with scottish labour leader johann lamont campaigning for a no vote in the constituency of the deputy first minister , alex salmond
